alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:59PM MDT until July 04 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM MDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL JACKSON COUNTY... At 459 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cowdrey, or 46 miles southwest of Laramie, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Jackson County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
